paper_abstract: The problem of biclustering consists of the simultaneous clustering of rows and columns of a matrix such that each of the submatrices induced by a pair of row and column clusters is as uniform as possible. In this paper we approximate the optimal biclustering by applying one-way clustering algorithms independently on the rows and oil the columns of the input matrix. We show that such a solution yields a worst-case approximation ratio of 1 + root 2 under L-1-norm for 0-1 valued matrices, and of 2 under L-2-norm for real valued matrices. (c) 2008 Elsevier B.V.
